definition: to stand respectfully/(of trees, mountains) standing tall and majestic
to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately

sentences.english: An Afghan hound stands at attention.
sentences.chinese: 一隻阿富汗獵犬昂首肅立。

sentences.english: The crowd stood in respectful as the funeral procession went by.
sentences.chinese: 當送葬隊伍走過時，人羣沉默肅立。

sentences.english: The policeman would stand and salute.
sentences.chinese: 這時，警察就會肅立敬禮。

sentences.english: At 2:28 pm, Chinese people nationwide stood in silence for 3 minutes to mourn the victims with air sirens, car and bus horns wailing in grief.
sentences.chinese: 14時28分，全國人民集體肅立默哀3分鐘。

sentences.english: Some 100,000 Americans stood outside the church at the time of his funeral.
sentences.chinese: 在爲他舉行喪禮時，約10萬人在教堂外肅立致哀。

sentences.english: All those present were standing solemnly when the national anthem was played.

definition: Tonggu county in Yichun 宜春, Jiangxi
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
to offer flowers/to lay flowers (as a memorial)
an order (esp. army)/bugle call expressing military order/verbal command
lit. crow and peacock make no sound/absolute silence (idiom); not a single voice can be heard/absolute silence
to perform music/to play a tune
(of animals, the wind etc) to make a mournful sound/whine/moan/wail
